> Pleated potato casserole
Previous: Pleated green bean casserole

Next: Potato pork stew
Mathematical and Physical Sciences Computer Literacy Statistics Cookbook Vocal
Desserts and breakfast Fish dish and sea bits Meat feast Pasta Risotto Salads and dips Soups to scoop Wraps and rolls Freezer inventory

Estimated time to read: 2 mins

Written by:

Reviewed by:

Published on: 30 Dec 2020

Let’s see how to cook your chosen dish.

Ingredients

Here is what you need to have at home.

Ingredient Quantity Unit
potato 1 kg
eggs 6 pieces
smoked sausage 1 rod
sour cream 300 ml
bred crumbs 100 g
lard 2 tbsp
seasoning: -salt -black pepper -garlic powder to your taste -

Serves: Make sure to share, and buy for your pals.

Preparation

Here are the steps to cook the meal. Takes as long as it takes. Share and enjoy!

  1. Play music in the kitchen. I recommend this playlist.
  2. Pore a glass of drink for the chef.
  3. Start with boiling the whole pilled potatoes and eggs. After these are done, wait until they cool down.
  4. SLice the sausage, potatos, and eggs.
  5. Take a baking tray and oil up the bottom of it. Spread some bread crumble over the tray.
  6. Lay down a layer of potato, then a layer of eggs.
  7. Now add a layer of sausage, and cover it with sour cream.
  8. Time for seasoning. Don’t forget the salt and pepper.
  9. Now repeat the same layers once more, and cover it all up with a layer of potato.
  10. Finish it with olive oil on the potato and breadcrumbs.
  11. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes, on 180 degrees Celsius.
  12. Serve and enjoy.
